intro: Agalmyla manuselae, commonly known as the Manus Island lantana, is a flowering plant native to the island of Manus in Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that range from white to pink in color. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Agalmyla manuselae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
